message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Debate "character" for 德">
The author is considering "character" for 德. Those who voted against it — what is your single strongest objection to "character"? Those who voted for it — what is its single strongest advantage?

Also: we now know 性 does NOT appear as a standalone technical term in the collection, so the "nature" collision concern is off the table.

Brief responses — one strongest point each.
</teammate-message>

input.summary: Strongest advantage of "character": neutral and lightweight
input.content: **Strongest advantage:** "Character" is the only option that is simultaneously lightweight enough for dense running text AND neutral enough to let the author's argument define the term rather than the English word pre-defining it. Every other option either over-specifies ("constitutive nature" pre-announces the constructivist conclusion) or misleads ("virtue" pre-announces a moral reading). "Character" arrives empty-handed and lets the author fill it.
